title: [$50] Expense- When submitting expense to workspace chat from self DM, selected report is not obeyed

labels.name: Hourly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.36-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73041 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sddosindjsoidsjio1@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Account has self DM. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a workspace. 3. Go to workspace chat. 4. Create two reports. 5. (OPTIONAL) Rename the reports above to A and B respectively. 6. Go to self DM. 7. Create an expense. 8. Click Submit it to someone. 9. Select the workspace chat. 10. On confirm page, enter merchant. 11. On confirm page, click Report field. 12. Select the other report (Report A). 13. Click Create expense. 14. Go back to workspace chat. ## Expected Result: The expense will be submitted to Report A, which is the one selected on confirm page in Step 12. ## Actual Result: The expense is submitted to Report B. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9c8f83e3-6c71-48e6-a48a-a0b3052cc85d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.35-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @mallenexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761161182007609) ## Action Performed: 1. Open a 1:1 chat with another user 2. Press Cmd + K (Quick Search) 3. Observe the search options displayed ## Expected Result: The top option should be “Search in [current chat user]” to allow quick in-thread search. ## Actual Result: Recent searches are shown first, and “Search in [current chat user]” does not appear as the top option, reducing usability. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: Updates to "Contact method" section of New Expensify profile

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
## Background Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1759324105084269?thread_ts=1754324642.498629&cid=C07HPDRELLD), we'd like to improve how we surface and promote the functionality and benefits of having multiple contact methods in New Expensify. The screenshots below call out how we want the finished product to look. ## Details In New Expensify, under **Account > Profile > Public > Contact method**, here are the **two** changes we'd like to make: - [ ] Update from `Contact method` to `Contact methods` so it's clear you can add multiple - [ ] Ensure the field itself can support multiple contact methods (email and phone) in a list, if multiple have been added Clicking a layer deeper into the `Contact methods` screen, here are the **three** changes we'd like to make: - [ ] Update the copy at the top to: > Add more ways to log in and send receipts to Expensify. > > Add an email address to forward receipts to receipts@expensify.com, or add a phone number to text receipts to 47777 (US numbers only). - [ ] Above each contact method, include a new `Primary` or `Secondary` label - [ ] Remove the current copy below the primary contact method, which reads: > Whenever we need to get in touch with you, we'll use this contact method. **[Figma link](https://www.figma.com/design/MLeWGyEkyC5s3MoBhmuIMr/Contact-Methods-Improvements?node-id=40-9395&p=f&t=0g4XgUScyE2bvc86-11)** cc @Expensify/design for viz
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @allroundexperts

___

**Version Number:** v9.2.34-2
**Reproducible in staging?:** y
**Reproducible in production?:** y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @twisterdotcom 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05S5EV2JTX/p1760251072024579

## Action Performed:
1. Open a travel expense
2. Click the receipt
3. Click "View Trip" in the top right

## Expected Result:
The user should have been brought to the trip booking with details

## Actual Result:
Nothing happens

## Workaround:
The user can manually go to the trip room

labels.name: External

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.36-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1424/folder/18717689/49855697/965872280 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1946@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb) **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has a Self DM. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Navigate to Self DM. 3. Start a manual distance expense creation flow. 4. Add any distance and tap on "Next" 5. Tap on the "Rate" field. 6. Tap on "Upgrade" to create a workspace. 7. Tap on "Got It, thanks" 8. Use device´s back button. 9. Note that you land on "Upgrade" page again. 10. Tap on "Upgrade" one more time. 11. Return to "Inbox" 12. Note that two different workspaces were created. ## Expected Result: Using device´s back button after creating a workspace from the "Upgrade" page, should redirect to "Confirm Details" page again. ## Actual Result: After creating a track manual distance expense, and creating a new workspace from the "Upgrade" page on the rate option, using device´s back button leads to "Upgrade" page again. Everytime the user lands on "Upgrade" page again, a new workspace can be created. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/938ff618-c929-4a0e-bf4e-8470011a50db [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
